rationale: This species has a large extent of occurrence within east Africa with no known major widespread threats. It is therefore listed as Least Concern. It has also been assessed regionally as Least Concern for  eastern Africa. The status and distribution of this species in northeast Africa is unclear, and so has been categorised as Data Deficient for this region.
evaluator: Snoeks, J., Tweddle, D., Getahun, A., Lalèyè, P., Paugy, D., Zaiss, R., Fishar, M.R.A & Brooks, E.

taxonomicnotes: Clarias pachynema is closely related to C. ebriensis. It is possible that these species are synonymous, but since their geographical areas are distinctly separate and no material is available from the intermediate zone, it is better to consider them as separate species
rationale: The species is widespread without major threats throughout central Africa and is assessed as Least Concern.
evaluator: Brummett, R., Mbe Tawe, A.N., Dening Touokong, C., Reid, G.M., Snoeks, J. Staissny, M., Moelants, T., Mamonekene, V., Ndodet, B., Ifuta, S.N.B., Chilala, A., Monsembula, R., Ibala Zamba, A., Opoye Itoua, O., Pouomogne, V., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.
